message.content:
heliocentric model
Nicolaus Copernicus
scientific revolution
Ptolemaic system
Galileo Galilei
astronomy
polymath
Renaissance
planetary motion

Note: The terms listed above are related to the Copernican Revolution, which was a paradigm shift in astronomy that marked the transition from the geocentric model of the universe to the heliocentric model, with the sun at the center. The revolution is named after the astronomer Nicolaus Copernicus, who proposed the heliocentric model in the 16th century. Other key figures associated with the Copernican Revolution include Galileo Galilei, Johannes Kepler, and Tycho Brahe. The Copernican Revolution had far-reaching implications for science, philosophy, and culture, and is often considered one of the most important events in the history of ideas.
